body_html: In that case, maybe we could explore the async error reporting as @ibab mentioned. The tricky part is that we need to hold executor to wait for all the error checks to finish at the end. Otherwise, the run could finish successfully before the async error checking. And we need to be very careful that we don't cause a deadlock.
body_text: In that case, maybe we could explore the async error reporting as @ibab mentioned. The tricky part is that we need to hold executor to wait for all the error checks to finish at the end. Otherwise, the run could finish  successfully before the async error checking. And we need to be very careful that we don't cause a deadlock.
body: In that case, maybe we could explore the async error reporting as @ibab mentioned. The tricky part is that we need to hold executor to wait for all the error checks to finish at the end. Otherwise, the run could finish  successfully before the async error checking. And we need to be very careful that we don't cause a deadlock.
